name: places/ChIJEUd4ZVZYwokRoTM467I0ZR8
formattedAddress: 245 W 52nd St, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 245 W 52nd St, New York, NY 10019, USA

editorialSummary.text: Major productions are hosted in this 1925 theater, named for the Pulitzer-winning playwright.

originalText.text: This is one of the older theaters on Broadway and it is lovely, well kept and really adds to the theater experience. I went to see FUNNY GIRL and the show was very good. My seat was row Q in the center orchestra and my view was superb. I could see everything including the facial expressions. Seats were comfortable enough. I did get a little tight with my long legs near the end of the show. The rest rooms are in the main lobby and it was hard how they managed the lines to them during the intermission. Overall the theater is comfortable and the views are great.

originalText.text: This theater was beautiful. The line to get in and ticketing was handled very nicely. The drinks are very pricey but strong. The inside is very elegant but be aware the seating is not too spacious. I really enjoyed watching Lea Michele play fanny brice in funny girl!

text.text: This theater was beautiful. The line to get in and ticketing was handled very nicely. The drinks are very pricey but strong. The inside is very elegant but be aware the seating is not too spacious. I really enjoyed watching Lea Michele play fanny brice in funny girl!

originalText.text: We went to see Funny Girl this week at the August Wilson theater. The theater was fine. Nothing too fancy.  It’s relatively small. The rows are pretty narrow.  Not much leg room. The show was great and we saw Julie instead of Leah.  Julie was fantastic.

text.text: We went to see Funny Girl this week at the August Wilson theater. The theater was fine. Nothing too fancy.  It’s relatively small. The rows are pretty narrow.  Not much leg room. The show was great and we saw Julie instead of Leah.  Julie was fantastic.

originalText.text:
One of the older theaters on Broadway from the 1920"s . Seats are comfortable and we had lower orchestra seats row J, close to the stage.

Saw Lea Michele reprise Barbra Streisand leading role. She did an amazing job.

text.text:
One of the older theaters on Broadway from the 1920"s . Seats are comfortable and we had lower orchestra seats row J, close to the stage.

Saw Lea Michele reprise Barbra Streisand leading role. She did an amazing job.

originalText.text:
Super pretty. Great show. Would go again. Tight seats. One of our parties leg got pinched by the other seat as another person in our party sat down. No cup holders(older theater).Went to use the rest room after they opened the exit doors. They asked my fiancé as she was in the bathroom getting ready to shut the door to come out. They directed us to walk outside onto the sidewalk and go back in the front door to the main lobby bathroom. Would for sure for again just giving honest feedback.
Got two alcoholic double drinks and a bottle of water $57 dollars. Souvenir cups at least.

Row J seat 106-108
